paper_abstract: The discovery of non-taxonomical relationships is one of the less studied knowledge acquisition tasks, even though it is a crucial point in ontology learning. We present an automatic and unsupervised methodology for extracting non-taxonomically related concepts and labelling relationships, using the whole Web as learning corpus. We also discuss how the obtained relationships may be automatically evaluated, using relatedness measures based on WordNet.
paper_title: Discovering non-taxonomic relations from the web
